page.title: 09Norton Green
page.content: The Green covers an area of about 2 football pitches. It is roughly circular with a road running through the middle. In the centre is a small pond known as the duck pond and a small group of houses. The church overlooks the Green which is bordered by tall trees along one side. It is the site of an ancient market and many other village fayres and events have been held here. Originally it was the centre of village life and for many years there was a blacksmith (who used the duck pond to cool his hot horseshoes, cartwheels etc) a bakehouse and a tannery. One of the buildings in the centre has a large clock by which the village people kept there own clocks right.
